description.narrative: Med hänvisning till Country Plan 2009, ALAT begäran den 11 augusti 2010, på djupet promemoria daterad den 13 oktober 2010, protokoll från Country Team Project kommittén föreslås det att stödet ALAT som skall godkännas med en total budget på 20.000.000 kronor från 2010 - 2013

Sweden has is providing core support for institutional development to the Association of Local Government Authorities in Tanzania - ALAT in accordance to the project document dated 11 August 2010. The project has two main goals - to strengthen the institutional capacity and, secondly to support the four communities based management in natural resources as well as to disseminate best.

participating-org.narrative: ALAT/Association of Local Authorities of Tanzania

sector.narrative: Decentralisation and support to subnational government

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2014Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: This is an old contribution 51170008. The agreement ended in 31 March 2015. The activity period ended in June 2014. Reporting was on calendar year and was extended to June 2014, however the audit and financial reporting is on a broken year July - June (fiscal year).
In 2014 ALAT continued with financial management transformation, which involved improvement of its internal Control systems, finalization of accounts and audit. ALAT managed to purchase human resource software to enhance its transformation.
ALAT, has actively participated and contributed in the Constitutional Review process.
Activities to the Community Based in Natural Resources Management has progressed well. Results acheived in SULEDO Land Forest Reserve are threefold: Organizational strengthening; Sustainable forest management including harvesting; and Beekeeping development. Meanwhile, SULEDO continued producing and setting up new beacons and sign boards at their boarders. SULEDO is still waiting for a positive decision from the Forest Beekeeping Department regarding the application for SULEDO’s own hammer with an official SULEDO mark to be used in the harvesting operations, as stipulated in the forestry regulations and guidelines from Ministry.
Burunge Wildlife Management Area has experienced challenges during the last year. Revenue collection carried out by the Ministry of Natural Resources and Tourism since May 2012, has negatively affected their annual workplans and budget. Only small amount of money are transferred to Burunge from the Ministry but not on regular basis and without any detail explanation. This situation jeopardizes the management of activities such as patrolling, and social investments in the villages. ALAT continue to lobby on this issue, on behalf of Burunge and it seems that a joint revenue collection (Ministry together with Burunge) may be possible in the near future.
Mwitija and Latema Water User Associations (WUA) completed most activities included in the extended MoU (2012/2013). A serious delay in some activities was caused by an accident of the association Chairman in April 2014.
Challenges: Latema as well as Mwitija are experiencing major problems with regards to soil erosion. This problem affects the villages especially during the rainy season, with damage in infrastructure (houses, roads and water pipelines). Some soil conservation activities have been implemented, more specifically trenches or channels to cut the surface run off, and some limitation in the movement of livestock. These kinds of activities are important, but they not addressing the causes of the problems, such as overgrazing, deforestation and inadequate agricultural activities.
Efforts are underway in collaboration with the District Council Officers (in agriculture, livestock, forestry, and water) to put in place a coordinated and integrated approach where different groups of interests (water users, soil conservation, pastoralists, farmers and forest groups) reach consensus on the problem and initiate corrective measures and actively engage in implementation.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
